Notice to Claimants for Prospective Medical Expenses
When recurring medical expenses are first allowed, send a notice
informing the claimant of the basis of the award, and
advising that failure to report a reduction in unreimbursed expenses or an increase in income will result inÂ an overpayment.
When recurring medical expenses are disallowed, send a notice
informing the claimant of the basis of the disallowance, and
advising that VA will consider all reported actual medical expenses at the end of the reporting period if the claimant submits
VA Form 21P-8416
verifying that the expenses have been paid.
